a(n1,n2).description: Returns the counterclockwise angle, in radians, between the positive `X`-axis and the point on the plane at coordinates `(n2,n1)`. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.atan2`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/atan2) method.

c(n).description: Returns the cosine of `n`, assuming `n` to be an angle in radians. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.cos`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/cos) method.

e(n).description: Returns Euler's Constant raised to the power of `n`. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.exp`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/exp) method.

g(n).description: Returns the `n`th number in the Fibonacci sequence.

h(n/a,...,n/a).description: Returns the result of concatenating all arguments to a single array and calculating the square root of the sum of its squares. Could only accept numeric arguments prior to [v:1.4.6]. Similar to JavaScript's [`Math.hypot`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/hypot) method.

l(n).description: Returns the natural logarithm of `n`. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.log`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/log) method.

m(n).description: Returns the base-2 logarithm of `n`. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.log2`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/log2) method.

n(n).description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of `n`. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.log10`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/log10) method.

q(n=2).description: Returns a random integer from the range `[0,n)` if `n` is positive, or `[n,0)` if `n` is negative.

q(n1,n2,n3=1).description: Returns a random multiple of `n3`, relative to `n1`, from the range `[n1,n2)`.

r(n=1).description: Returns a random float from the range `[0,n)`.

r(n1,n2).description: Returns a random float from the range `[n1,n2)`.

s(n).description: Returns the sine of `n`, assuming `n` to be an angle in radians. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.sin`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/sin) method.

t(n).description: Returns the tangent of `n`, assuming `n` to be an angle in radians. Equivalent to JavaScript's [`Math.tan`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math/tan) method.
